newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Ulster Bank names Wilson as chief exec designate.
newsitem.headline: Ulster Bank names Wilson as chief exec designate.

text.p: Ulster Bank, the Irish subsidiary of National Westminster Bank Plc, said on Thursday that it had appointed Martin Wilson as deputy group chief executive with effect from March 31, 1997.
Wilson will assume the role of chief executive of Ulster Bank when the current CEO, Ronnie Kells, retires in 1998.
